description:
As a Softgoods Design Engineer, you’ll be working with the Hardware Design team to produce Google prototypes, and enable strategies for mass production. This will include Softgoods Design and Research, knit machine operation and other manufacturing operations. Additionally, you will interface with designers by researching and developing new materials and construction methods to deliver breakthrough experiences for our products.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Textile Engineering, Product Design Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, a similar engineering discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of work experience with manufacturing softgoods products (e.g CNC knitting machine programming across a wide variety of gauges, machine operation and maintenance).
  • Experience with various textile materials, including synthetic and natural yarns and fibers; and knitted textile design and construction techniques of challenging technical patterns (e.g. structure fit and 3D shape development).
  • Experience with manufacturing/assembly processes (e.g. knitting, weaving, flatbed digital cutting, sewing, laser cutting, bonding and finishing).

Preferred qualifications:

  • 7 years of work experience in softgoods product development for wearable consumer products.
  • 5 years of experience in consumer electronics product development.
  • Experience designing tests and performing experiments.
  • Working knowledge of material analysis and failure analysis techniques.
responsibilities:
• Identify and develop new softgoods materials and construction techniques for future products.
  • Work closely with the Industrial Design and Product Design teams on materials inspiration, softgoods selection, prototype fabrication and production designs for new products to achieve cosmetic and functional goals.
  • Be the go-to person for softgoods development strategies that can pass our product reliability testing.
  • Research cutting-edge and next-generation softgoods materials that can be brought into Google. Help engineer exciting softgoods materials and construction techniques that are aligned to Google’s design language.
title: Softgoods Design Engineer, Consumer Hardware
